text: Radalbuvir (INN, also known as GS-9669) is an experimental antiviral drug for the treatment of hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection developed by Gilead Sciences. Radalbuvir acts as an NS5B inhibitor. It is currently in clinical trials. ==References== Category:Antivirals Category:Thiophenes Category:Carboxylic acids Category:Experimental drugs Category:Tetrahydrofurans Category:Alkyne derivatives Category:Cyclohexenes Category:Tert-butyl compounds Category:Ethers
title: Radalbuvir
